History of Present Illness (HPI):
The patient has been working on communication with family members, particularly daughters and mother. 
        - Conversations with daughters have improved, leading to a sense of relief and pride. 
        - Efforts to engage with the mother have been challenging due to her focus on past issues, which has been overwhelming for the patient. 
        - The patient is beginning to accept their past decisions for mental health, noticing a reduction in feelings of guilt. 
        - Recent family bonding activities, like a movie night, have been positive experiences, prompting thoughts of planning more family activities. 
        - The patient is also trying to focus on body positivity and is open to exploring ways to foster this mindset.
Therapeutic Interventions:
The patient is encouraged to practice positive affirmations to foster a positive self-image. 
        - Affirmations created include: "I am worthy of love and respect just as I am", "I celebrate my uniqueness", and "I am strong and capable". 
        - The patient is advised to incorporate these affirmations into their daily routine.
Next Steps:
The patient plans to engage in more family activities and continue working on communication strategies. 
        - They feel more equipped to handle relationships and personal feelings moving forward.
